page.title: 02LOCAL CRAFTSMEN
page.content: Artists and craftsmen have long found rural surroundings helpful in their creative work. The Madley area can boast of three nationally known artists. Pat Griffin is a potter with a distintive style, aiming to reflect the typical British landscape within the framework of a hand crafted piece of traditional pottery. Karlin Rushbrook produces a wide range of hand blown glass from scent bottles to large bowls. Many items have patterns cut into the surface using a sand blasting technique. Glenn Storhaug is a poet who began printing and publishing his own work. Five Seasons Press is now a thriving concern with an international market.
